required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dengue Seroprevalence Study in Blood Donors in the French West Indies
clinical_study.official_title: Dengue Seroprevalence Study in Blood Donors in the French West Indies

collaborator.agency: Institut National de la Santé Et de la Recherche Médicale, France

brief_summary.textblock: Dengue is an infectious disease most prevalent in the world. This disease is endemic in the Caribbean, with an increase in seasonal rains. Several outbreaks have been observed in recent years, in 2001, 2005 and 2007, during which further particularly virulent serotypes have emerged. The clinical expression of dengue fever is variable, ranging from no symptoms to a classical form with fever, and even of severe or lethal bleeding. With the possible existence of silent forms of the disease, there are no data identifying the current level of protection of the population in Martinique / Guadeloupe.

detailed_description.textblock:
1. Principal objective:
To estimate the prevalence of the specific antibodies of the dengue (IgG) in blood donors in the French West Indies.
2. Secondary objective:
To specify the serotypic specificity of the anti-dengue antibodies detected during the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Presence or not of dengue virus-specific immunoglobulin G antibodies

secondary_outcome.measure: Characterization of dengue virus serotype-specific IgG
secondary_outcome.description: Characterization of dengue virus serotype-psecific IgG whendengue virus serotype-specific immunoglobulin G antibodies Test is positive

study_pop.textblock: Adult, résidents in Martinique/ Guadeloupe (french west indies), aged 18 to 65 years coming to give their blood in one of the building or mobile collection facilities of the French Blood Establishment in French West Indies.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Eligible for blood donation following the French legislation,
- Resident in Martinique /Guadeloupe for at least one year
- Consent signed
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not Eligible for blood donation following the French legislation,
- Not Resident in Martinique / Guadeloupe for at least one year
- Consent not signed
